member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeries`2.EnableMutation
member.summary: Enables mutation for in-place operations. Should only be used by derived classes during controlled mutations.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeries`2.DisableMutation
member.summary: Disables mutation after in-place operations complete.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeries`2.UpdateInPlace(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeriesItem{`0,`1}})
member.summary: Updates the internal data structures during in-place operations.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeries`2.UpdateSortedValues
member.summary: Updates the sorted values from the dictionary during in-place operations.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.IndexedSeries`2.UpdateProperties
member.summary: Updates Start, End, and IsEmpty properties.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.AddNullResultsInNull
member.summary: Adds the right to the left value. Null values results in null.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.Add
member.summary: Adds the right to the left value. Null values will be replaced with 0.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.SubtractNullResultsInNull
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values results in null (null - 1 => null).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.Subtract
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values will be replaced with 0 (null - 1 => -1).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.MultiplyNullResultsInNull
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values results in null (null * 1 => null).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.Multiply
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values will be replaced with 0 (null * 1 => 0).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.DivideNullResultsInNull
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values results in null (null / 1 => null).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.Divide
member.summary: Subtracts the left from the right value. Null values will be replaced with 0 (null / r => 0; 1 / null => null).

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation.TakeRight
member.summary: Takes always the right value.

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.SingleValueNullBehavior.AggregationValueBecomesNull
member.summary: If one value is null, the whole aggregation value becomes null.

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.SingleValueNullBehavior.AggregationValueBecomesZero
member.summary: If one value is null, the whole aggregation value becomes zero (0).

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.SingleValueNullBehavior.SingleValueBecomesZero
member.summary: If one value is null, the single value becomes zero (0) and will be considered for aggregation (only relevant for average, min, max).

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.SingleValueNullBehavior.SingleValueWillBeIgnoredForAggregation
member.summary: If one value is null, the single value will be ignored for aggregation (only relevant for average, min, max).

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period.FromTimePoints(System.DateTimeOffset,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Creates an period from 2 time points.
member.param: The first time point.
The second time point.
member.returns: The period that describes the difference between the 2 specified time points.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period.GenerateTimePointSequence(System.DateTimeOffset,System.TimeZoneInfo)
member.summary: Creates an infinite sequence of time points
member.param: The first time point to use.
The time zone to use.
member.returns: An infinite sequence of time points

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period.GenerateTimePointSequence(System.DateTime,System.TimeZoneInfo)
member.summary: Creates an infinite sequence of time points
member.param: The first time point to use.
The time zone to use.
member.returns: An infinite sequence of time points

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleOption.ResampleType
member.summary: Gets or sets the resample type.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleOption.SingleValueIsNull
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior for single values within an list of values that are resampled.

member.name: T:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleType
member.summary: The resample type.

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleType.Absolut
member.summary: Resampling considers the absolut period interval. E.g. monthly time series form 01.02.2022 to 01.02.2023 resampled to year results in 2 time points (01.02.2022 - 31.12.2022 and 01.01.2022 to 31.12.2023).

member.name: F:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleType.Relative
member.summary: Resampling considers the relative period interval. E.g. monthly time series form 01.02.2022 to 01.02.2023 resampled to year results in 1 time points (01.02.2022 - 01.02.2023).

member.name: T:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame
member.summary: A time frame is a collection of named time series with the same frequency that can be processed together.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the time frame.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of time series within the frame.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Start
member.summary: Gets the first time point of the frame.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.End
member.summary: Gets the last time point of the frame.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Frequency
member.summary: Gets the frequency of all time series within the frame.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets the time zone object of this time frame.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.EnumerateTimePoints
member.summary: Enumerates all time points of the frame.
member.returns: An Enumeration of all time points.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.EnumerateTimeSeries
member.summary: Enumerates all time points of the frame.
member.returns: An Enumeration of all time points.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.EnumerateNames
member.summary: Enumerates all names of the frame.
member.returns: An enumeration of all names.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Add(System.String,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries)
member.summary: Adds a time series with the specified name to the frame. Note that the frequency of the time series must be equal to the frequency of the frame.
member.param: The name to use for the time series.
The time series to add.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the time series with the specified name from the frame.
member.param: The name of the time series to remove.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Copy
member.summary: Creates a copy of the TimeFrame.
member.returns: The copy of the time frame.

member.summary: Resamples all time series within the frame to the specified period.
member.param: The period.
The aggregation type used for all time series.
The to use.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.ReSample(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.AggregationType)
member.summary: Resamples all time series within the frame to the specified period.
member.param: The period.
The aggregation type used for all time series.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.ReSample(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.AggregationType},Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ResampleOption)
member.summary: Resamples all time series within the frame to the specified period using the specified aggregation types.
member.param: The period.
A dictionary containing one aggregation type for each time series name.
The to use.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.ReSample(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period,System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary{System.String,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.AggregationType})
member.summary: Resamples all time series within the frame to the specified period using the specified aggregation types.
member.param: The period.
A dictionary containing one aggregation type for each time series name.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.AddPeriodTo(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Adds a period to the specified time point considering the frequency and the time zone of the current time frame.
member.param: The time point to add a period to.
member.returns: A new time point.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Item(System.String[])
member.summary: Returns a new time frame with the specified time series.
member.param: The names of the time series to get.
member.returns: A new time frame with the specified time series.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets the time series with the specified name.
member.param: The name of the time series to get.
member.returns: The time series with the specified name.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeFrame.Item(System.String,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Gets the value of the time series with the specified name for the specified time point.
member.param: The name of the time series to get the value for.
The time to get the value for.
member.returns: The value of the time series with the specified name for the specified time point.

member.name: T:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries
member.summary: A time series holds a list of time point / value pairs. Time points are represented as DateTimeOffsets, values as nullable decimals. The time span between two time points (the Frequency) is always identical for the whole time series.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Factory
member.summary: The factory contains methods for creating time series object. IT can be extended by custom extension methods for the interface.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Settings
member.summary: The settings object can be used to configure the time flow framework.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.TimeZone
member.summary: Gets the time zone object of this time series.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Values
member.summary: Gets the value of the time series.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.TimePoints
member.summary: Gets the time points of the time series.

member.name: P:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Frequency
member.summary: Gets the frequency of this time series.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.AddPeriodTo(System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Adds a period to the specified time point considering the frequency and the time zone of the current time frame.
member.param: The time point to add a period to.
member.returns: A new time point.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Apply(System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Returns a new time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function.
member.param: The mapping function to use.
member.returns: A new date time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Apply(System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Maps all values using the specified mapping function.
member.param: The mapping function to use.
If true, modifies this time series instance instead of creating a new one. Default is false.
member.returns: A time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function. If inPlace is true, returns this instance; otherwise returns a new instance.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.ApplyValues(System.Func{System.Decimal,System.Decimal})
member.summary: Returns a new date time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function whereas null values remain as null values.
member.param: The mapping function to use for mapping non-nullable values.
member.returns: A new date time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function whereas null values remain as null values.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.ApplyValues(System.Func{System.Decimal,System.Decimal},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Maps all values using the specified mapping function whereas null values remain as null values.
member.param: The mapping function to use for mapping non-nullable values.
If true, modifies this time series instance instead of creating a new one. Default is false.
member.returns: A time series where all values are mapped using the specified mapping function whereas null values remain as null values. If inPlace is true, returns this instance; otherwise returns a new instance.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinLeft(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.
The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. The first value of the aggregation function is from this time series, the second value from the passed one.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinLeft(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,System.Func{System.DateTimeOffset,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.

The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. 1. value: Timestamp of the time point to aggregate 2. value: Value of the first time series. 3. value: Value of the second time series.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinLeft(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.JoinOperation)
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.
The join operation to use.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.
The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. The first value of the aggregation function is from this time series, the second value from the passed one.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinFull(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,System.Func{System.DateTimeOffset,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.

The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. 1. value: Timestamp of the time point to aggregate 2. value: Value of the first time series. 3. value: Value of the second time series.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinFull(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The first time series to join.
The second time series to join.
The aggregation function to combine values from 3 equal time points. The first value of the aggregation function is from this time series, the second value from ts1 and the third from ts2.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.JoinFull(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries,System.Func{System.DateTimeOffset,System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal},System.Nullable{System.Decimal}})
member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The first time series to join.
The second time series to join.

The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. 1. value: Timestamp of the time point to aggregate 2. value: Value of the first time series. 3. value: Value of the second time series. 4. value: Value of the third time series.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The first time series to join.
The second time series to join.
The third time series to join.

The aggregation function to combine values from 4 equal time points. The first value of the aggregation function is from this time series, the second value from ts1 and the third from ts2 and the fourth from ts3.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The first time series to join.
The second time series to join.
The third time series to join.

The aggregation function to combine values from 2 equal time points. 1. value: Timestamp of the time point to aggregate 2. value: Value of the first time series. 3. value: Value of the second time series. 4. value: Value of the third time series. 5. value: Value of the 4th time series.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

member.summary: Joins the specified time series to the this time series using the specified aggregation function to combine the values.
member.param: The time series to join.
The join operation to use.
member.returns: A new time series with the same time points as this one but with values produced by the join.

The aggregation type to use for up/down sampling
The resample options to use.

member.summary: Creates a new time series with changed frequency.

The aggregation type to use for up/down sampling
member.returns: A new time series with the new frequency.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Slice(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates a new time series that contains only time points for the specified day. If the day is not part of this time series, an empty day will be returned.
member.param: The date to get the new time series for.
member.returns: A new time series that contains only time points for the specified day.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Slice(System.DateTimeOffset,System.DateTimeOffset)
member.summary: Creates a new time series that contains only time points for the specified time range. Time points within the time range that are not part of the time series are not generated.
member.param: The including start time.
The including end time.
member.returns: A new time series that contains only time points for the specified range.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Slice(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new time series that contains only time points for the specified range.
member.param: The zero based start index.
The number of time points to get.
member.returns: A new time series that contains only time points for the specified range.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.Trim(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Nullable{System.Decimal}[])
member.summary: Creates a new time series where leading and trailing time points with specified values are dropped.
member.param: Specifies if leading time points should be dropped. Default: true.
Specifies if trailing time points should be dropped. Default: true.
The value to trim.
member.returns: A new time series where leading and trailing time points with specified values are dropped.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.ShiftRight(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period)
member.summary: Shifts all time point of the time series by the specified time period (adds the period to the time points).
member.param: The period to use for shift.
member.returns: A new time series that's time points has been shifted by the specified period.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeries.ShiftLeft(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period)
member.summary: Shifts all time point of the time series by the specified time period (subtracts the period from the time points).
member.param: The period to use for shift.
member.returns: A new time series that's time points has been shifted by the specified period.

member.summary: Creates an empty time series.

The frequency to use. Note that the frequency have to match the time points in the dictionary.
The time zone to use. (Default: 'W. Europe Standard Time')
member.returns: A new time series with the generated values.

member.name: M:Thinksharp.TimeFlow.TimeSeriesFactoryExtensions.FromDictionary(Thinksharp.TimeFlow.ITimeSeriesFactory,System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.DateTimeOffset,System.Decimal},System.DateTimeOffset,System.DateTimeOffset,Thinksharp.TimeFlow.Period,System.TimeZoneInfo)
member.summary: Creates a new time series for the specified dictionary. The times series starts by the first and ends with the last time time point in the dictionary.
member.param: The dictionary that contains the time points to use.
The first time point of the time series.
The last time point of the time series.
The frequency to use. Note that the frequency have to match the time points in the dictionary.
The time zone to use. (Default: 'W. Europe Standard Time')
member.returns: A new time series with the generated values.
